Presenting Complaints (Symptoms):
Presenting Symptoms: Anxiety 
Chief Complaints:
1) Anxious for his upcoming aptitude test for a promotion at work. 
2) Fear of failure.
3) Racing heart and shaking hands during anxiety
History: Past History: Patient has a history of failure in third grade which stayed with him and was an embarrassing experience for him.
Current Mental Status Examination: General appearance & behavior: Anxious; Speech: normal, Mood & Affect: depressed; Thought: worrisome and ruminated, Perception: normal Cognitive functions: Mildly clouded, Judgement and Insight: Intact
Psychotherapy Technique: Reflective listening, Cognitive restructuring, Problem solving and Thought Challenging.
Issues discussed in Current Session:
Following are the issues discussed in session:
1)Anxiety: Patient feels stressed and anxious about an upcoming aptitude test for a promotion at work. She experiences physical symptoms such as a racing heart and shaking hands.
2)Past-History: Patient has negative experience with testing in third grade, where she got failed in a math test. This experience stayed with her and lead to anxiety and fear of failure when it comes to tests. This has become her core belief that she is destined to be a failure.
3)Strategies: Therapist suggests adaptive responses cope with her anxiety during the test which includes self-talk to reduce panic symptoms, focusing on answering questions one at a time, and accepting that the failure on the test is not a failure of life. Also, he suggested her to focus on past successes to motivate herself.
Action Plan: The therapist suggests adaptive responses to cope with her anxiety during the test which include using self-talk, focusing on answering questions one at a time, and understanding that failure on the test does not equate to overall failure in life or career.
